verses.verse: "However, <WH199> Job, <WH347> please hear <WH8085> my speech, <WH4405> and listen <WH8085> to all my words. <WH1697>
See now, <WH6605> I have opened my mouth. <WH6310> My tongue <WH3956> has spoken <WH1696> in my mouth. <WH2441>
My words <WH561> shall utter the uprightness <WH3476> of my heart. <WH3820> That which my lips <WH8193> know <WH1847> they shall speak <WH4448> sincerely. <WH1305>
The Spirit <WH7307> of God <WH410> has made <WH6213> me, <WH5397> and the breath of the Almighty <WH7706> gives me life. <WH2421>
If you can, <WH3201> answer <WH7725> me. <WH6186> Set your words in order before <WH6440> me, <WH3320> and stand forth.
Behold, <WH410> I am toward God even as you are. <WH6310> I am also formed <WH7169> out of the clay. <WH2563>
Behold, <WH367> my terror shall not make you afraid, <WH1204> neither shall my pressure <WH405> be heavy on you. <WH3513>
"Surely you have spoken <WH559> in my hearing, <WH241> I have heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of your words, <WH4405> saying,
<WH2134> 'I am clean, without disobedience. <WH6588> I am innocent, <WH2643> neither is there iniquity in me. <WH5771>
Behold, <WH4672> he finds occasions <WH8569> against me. <WH2803> He counts me for his enemy. <WH341>
He puts <WH7760> my feet <WH7272> in the stocks. <WH5465> He marks <WH8104> all my paths. <WH734>'
"Behold, <WH6030> I will answer you. <WH6663> In this you are not just, for God <WH433> is greater <WH7235> than man. <WH582>
Why do you strive <WH7378> against him, <WH6030> because he doesn't give account of any of his matters? <WH1697>
For God <WH410> speaks <WH1696> once, <WH259> yes twice, <WH8147> though man pays no attention. <WH7789>
In a dream, <WH2472> in a vision <WH2384> of the night, <WH3915> when deep <WH8639> sleep falls <WH5307> on men, <WH582> in slumbering <WH8572> on the bed; <WH4904>
Then he opens <WH1540> the ears <WH241> of men, <WH582> and seals <WH2856> their instruction, <WH4561>
That he may withdraw <WH5493> man <WH120> from his purpose, <WH4639> and hide <WH3680> pride <WH1466> from man. <WH1397>
He keeps back <WH2820> his soul <WH5315> from the pit, <WH7845> and his life <WH2416> from perishing <WH5674> by the sword. <WH7973>
He is chastened <WH3198> also with pain <WH4341> on his bed, <WH4904> with continual <WH7230> strife <WH386> in his bones; <WH6106>
So that his life <WH2416> abhors <WH2092> bread, <WH3899> and his soul <WH5315> dainty <WH8378> food. <WH3978>
His flesh <WH1320> is so consumed away, <WH3615> that it can't <WH7210> be seen. His bones <WH6106> that were not seen <WH7200> stick out. <WH8192>
Yes, <WH5315> his soul draws near <WH7126> to the pit, <WH7845> and his life <WH2416> to the destroyers. <WH4191>
"If there <WH3426> is beside him an angel, <WH4397> an interpreter, <WH3887> one <WH259> among a thousand, <WH505> to show <WH5046> to man <WH120> what is right for him; <WH3476>
then God is gracious <WH2603> to him, <WH559> and says, <WH6308> 'Deliver him from going down <WH3381> to the pit, <WH7845> I have found <WH4672> a ransom. <WH3724>'
His flesh <WH1320> shall be fresher <WH7375> than a child <WH5290>'s. He returns <WH7725> to the days <WH3117> of his youth. <WH5934>
He prays <WH6279> to God, <WH433> and he is favorable <WH7521> to him, <WH7200> so that he sees his face <WH6440> with joy. <WH8643> He restores <WH7725> to man <WH582> his righteousness. <WH6666>
He sings <WH7789> before men, <WH582> and says, <WH559> <WH2398> 'I have sinned, and perverted <WH5753> that which was right, <WH3477> and it didn't <WH7737> profit me.
He has redeemed <WH6299> my soul <WH5315> from going <WH5674> into the pit. <WH7845> My life <WH2416> shall see <WH7200> the light. <WH216>'
"Behold, <WH410> God works <WH6466> all these things, <WH6471> twice, yes three times, with a man, <WH1397>
to bring back <WH7725> his soul <WH5315> from the pit, <WH7845> that he may be enlightened <WH215> with the light <WH216> of the living. <WH2416>
Mark well, <WH7181> Job, <WH347> and listen <WH8085> to me. <WH2790> Hold your peace, and I will speak. <WH1696>
If you have <WH3426> anything to say, <WH4405> answer <WH7725> me. <WH1696> Speak, for I desire <WH2654> to justify you. <WH6663>
If not, <WH8085> listen to me. <WH2790> Hold your peace, and I will teach <WH502> you wisdom. <WH2451>"
